message: The cafeteria is deserted and quiet.
Even though wind carrying fine dust blows in from the fireplace where the fire has gone out, the smell of the food from a few hours ago still lingers.
There's already no one left in the cafeteria.
It looks like breakfast has been completely cleared away, but did Mrs. Hudson not leave any for me？
Even if I did have breakfast, I wouldn't have time to eat it anyway.
If I care too much about it, won't people think I'm kind of wimpy？
The cafeteria is deserted and quiet.
Even though a wind mixed with fine dust is blowing in from the Fireplace where the fire's gone out, the smell of food from a few hours ago is still hanging in the air.
It doesn't seem like anything fun is going to happen if I stay here.
There's no one else in the room but me. My footsteps on the wooden floor and the creaking sounds echo through the room in such a heavy, ominous way that it almost feels foreboding.
What the hell am I even doing? At this rate, I'm basically sneaking around like a servant trying to snag some leftover dinner.
Doesn't seem like there's anything particularly interesting here......
There are scratches left here and there, like proof that it's been used for a long time.
Apparently, among the people who used this dining room, there were some who can't exactly be called sensible.
There's nothing here that grabs my interest.
Thanks to Mrs. Hudson, the bread crumbs and sauce stains have all been neatly cleaned up. I wonder if that meticulous lady changes the cloth every single time.
Entrance hall
Mrs. Hudson's room
Mrs. Hudson's room
My room
I left the dining room and decided to head back to my own room.
